newsitem.title: JAPAN: North Korea frees detained American Hunziker.
newsitem.headline: North Korea frees detained American Hunziker.

text.p: American Carl Hunziker, detained in North Korea for three months, arrived in Tokyo on Wednesday with U.S. Congressman Bill Richardson, who negotiated his release, a U.S. military spokesman said.

"Congressman Richardson and Mr Hunziker have arrived in Japan," U.S. military spokesman Kevin Krejcarek told reporters at a U.S. air base on the outskirts of Tokyo where their U.S. military plane landed.
The 26-year-old Hunziker, who his family says is a missionary, was detained by North Korea near the Chinese border on August 24 and held on charges of espionage and illegal entry into North Korea.
The United States, South Korea and Hunziker's family have all denied he is a spy and say he accidentally strayed into North Korea while on a visit to China.

Richardson, a close confidant of President Bill Clinton, and Hunziker had been scheduled to leave North Korea for Tokyo on Tuesday but their departure was delayed for a day for as yet unknown reasons.
